Understanding the Modern Military
Service Options

Service Options

Now that you know what a students’ career interests are, this section will help you to understand the different options they have to serve.

Learning Objectives

  • Use career pathways tools to explore the requirements and options available within the military.
  • Compare and contrast career paths across military branches.
  • Identify which career options might be best for individual students.

School Counselor Professional Development Standards

This section is aligned with the following School Counselor Professional Development Standards as established by the Michigan Department of Education.

1.5

Understanding how to provide early, ongoing exposure in a comprehensive K-12 college and postsecondary program to experiences and current information necessary to make informed decisions and college selection as it relates to career aspirations and military options.

2.3

Understanding career counseling, including opportunities for students with interests in industry, business, technology, professional trades, and military career options.

ASCA School Counselor Professional Standards and Competencies

This section is aligned with the following ASCA School Counselor Professional Standards & Competencies as esablished by the American School Counselor Association.

A.4.b.

Provide and advocate for individual students’ preK–postsecondary college and career awareness, exploration and postsecondary planning and decision making, which supports the students’ right to choose from the wide array of options when students complete secondary education.

A.14.a a.

Demonstrate appropriate selection and use of technology and software applications to enhance students’ academic, career and social/emotional development. Attention is given to the ethical and legal considerations of technological applications, including confidentiality concerns, security issues, potential limitations and benefits and communication practices in electronic media.
